title: 105_s243
content: The Act may be cited as the "Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act" and involves the temporary reinstatement of airport and airway trust fund taxes. The Fuel Tax rate specified in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to 4.3 cents per gallon after December 31, 1996, and before the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act, and after September 29, 1997. The Fuel Tax rate in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to 4.3 cents per gallon after December 31, 1996, and before the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act, and after September 29, 1997. The Fuel Tax rate in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to 4.3 cents per gallon after December 31, 1996, and before the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act. The Act specifies the termination periods for taxes imposed during specific timeframes. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act amends various sections of the Internal Revenue Code, specifying termination periods for taxes imposed during specific timeframes. This includes changes to ticket taxes and transfers to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund. Subsection (b) of section 9502 is amended to change the effective date from January 1, 1997, to September 30, 1997. Paragraph (3) of section 9502(f) is also amended to set the Airport and Airway Trust Fund financing rate to zero for taxes imposed after December 31, 1996, and before 7 calendar days after the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act. Before the tax-increase date described in paragraph (3)(A)(i), a floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon is imposed on aviation fuel held by any person on that date. A floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon is imposed on aviation fuel held by a person on a tax-increase date. The person holding the fuel is liable for the tax and must pay it as prescribed by the Secretary by the first day of the 7th month beginning on the tax-increase date. A floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon is imposed on aviation fuel held by a person on a tax-increase date. The tax must be paid on or before the first day of the 7th month after the tax-increase date. Definitions include "the Code" referring to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, "tax-increase date" as 7 calendar days after the enactment of the Act, and "aviation fuel" as defined by section 4093 of the Code. The term "aviation fuel" is defined by section 4093 of the Code. Aviation fuel is considered held by a person if title has passed to that person. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Treasury. The tax on aviation fuel held on the tax-increase date does not apply to certain uses. On the tax-increase date, aviation fuel held for specific uses may be exempt from the tax imposed by section 4091 of the Code. No tax is imposed on aviation fuel held if the amount does not exceed 2,000 gallons. On the tax-increase date, aviation fuel held for specific uses may be exempt from the tax if the amount does not exceed 2,000 gallons. Fuel exempt from tax under paragraph (4) is not considered for this exemption. Controlled groups are defined for this purpose. On the tax-increase date, aviation fuel held for specific uses may be exempt from the tax if the amount does not exceed 2,000 gallons. Controlled groups are defined as treated as one group according to specific criteria. On the tax-increase date, aviation fuel held for specific uses may be exempt from the tax if the amount does not exceed 2,000 gallons. Controlled groups are defined as treated as one group according to specific criteria. Regulations allow for substitution of "more than 50 percent" for "at least 80 percent" in certain cases. Under regulations set by the Secretary, similar principles to clause (i) apply to a group of persons under common control where one or more of those persons is not a corporation. All provisions of law, including penalties, applicable to taxes imposed by section 4091 of the Code also apply to floor stock taxes imposed by paragraph (1). The amendments made by this section take effect 7 days after the date of enactment of this Act. The taxes imposed by sections 4261 and 4271 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 do not apply to amounts paid for taxable transportation. The taxes imposed by sections 4261 and 4271 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 do not apply to amounts paid for taxable transportation after December 31, 1996, and before the effective date of the amendments made by this section. SEC. 3 amends Section 9502(b) of the Code to transfer taxes collected during the taxable period regardless of when they were paid. The amendment applies to amounts received after December 31, 1995.
